information when needed Enhancing data collection procedures to include information that is relevant for building analytic systems Processing, cleansing, and verifying the integrity of data used for analysis Doing ad-hoc analysis and presenting results in a clear manner Creating automated anomaly detection systems and constant tracking of its performance Verify correctness and completeness of data model, data relationships, mappings, and reports Perform other duties as requested by supervisor  Qualifications: Bachelor's or MIS degree in Data Science, Operational Research, Mathematics/Statistics or equivalent experience 4+ years of experience implementing machine learning techniques and algorithms, such as k-NN, Naive Bayes, SVM, Decision Forests, etc. 4+ years of experience with common data science toolkits, such as R, Weka, Python, etc. Excellence in at least one of these is highly desirable 4+ years of proven experience in database programming (SQL, stored procedures, etc.) 4+ years of experience working with Business Intelligence tools (experience with PowerBI and OBIEE tools a plus) Understand multiple data sources such as Oracle, SQL Server, Azure, Teradata Ability to solve complex and cross-functional projects spanning multiple technologies and disciplines Background in retail a plus Certifications a plus Ability to function as a team member and get along with others Comfortable with ambiguity as needs change on a regular basis with a high degree of initiative and sense of urgency Excellent oral and written skills with the ability to interact with senior management, technical subject matter experts, and business customers are all essential in this role Ability to work on multiple initiatives and projects simultaneously Travel 10% Comcast Ventures is seeking a data scientist to take the reins of, and lead our data-driven investment effort. Here at Comcast Ventures we leverage a variety of data sources to augment our investment process, from sourcing deals to conducting due-diligence and helping our portfolio companies. You will apply your business acumen and analytical skills to find great investment prospects, and partner with relevant team members to drive the investments. Finally, you will work with a select group of companies within the invite only accelerate program to help support and scale their businesses beyond the investment phase. About Comcast Ventures:Comcast Ventures is a financially-focused venture capital firm with the backing of Comcast as its sole LP. The team was founded in 1999 and invests across a broad array of industries including consumer, enterprise, and frontier technologies. The firm has offices in San Francisco, New York, Philadelphia and Los Angeles. To learn more about our team and our investments, visit www.comcastventures.com. About You:You have both excellent quantitative skills and great business acumen. You are very intellectually curious and enjoy thinking about problems at a high level. However, you are no spring chicken when it comes to getting deep in the analytical weeds to validate your hypotheses. You have a strong foundation in statistics and enjoy solving problems with data. You are interested in investing and want to help build scalable solutions to spot early traction in startups and help them grow. Finally, you enjoy interfacing with entrepreneurs and investors alike, and have no problem presenting your convictions to drive action. Aspects of the Job:- Developing and testing data-driven hypotheses around business models, industries, and ecosystems- Building and implementing scalable data models that identify early signs of product-market fit and company traction- Becoming a thought leader in data-driven venture investing- Sourcing and assisting on deals utilizing data, and influencing the investment team with data-driven findings- Build financial and predictive models on a variety of strategic initiatives for companies participating in the accelerate program.- Use external and internal data enrichment methods to improve customer acquisition efforts for portfolio companies- Analyze and interpret both internal and external data, and make it actionable for business purpose- Gain in-depth knowledge of how a successful start-up operates Qualifications:- 2+ years of experience in quantitative analysis- BA/BS in Computer Science, Engineering, Physics, Math, Engineering, Statistics or other technical field- Proficiency with Python and SQL. Expert in at least one statistical modeling/machine learning software (Python preferred)- 1+ years of hands-on, practical Excel use- Demonstrable critical thinking and analytical skills, including the ability and conviction to make conclusions and recommendations from data- Experience interacting with key stakeholders, and converting opportunities into actionable data-driven analysis and implementing science-driven data products- Strong verbal and written communication skills- Ability to work independently and in a team- Passion to learn a business from the inside out and propel its growth- Comfort with and aptitude for critically analyzing large quantities of data- Ability to clearly articulate and defend analytical findings Why Work Here:The Data Science role is an invaluable opportunity to learn the venture capital business while embedded in a team of experienced investors and seasoned operators. You will have access to unique and powerful datasets with the freedom to carve your own path and make advances in the nascent field of quantitative venture capital. Through your work here, you will gain an in depth understanding of different business models, how to judge their health and what levers exist to improve upon them. We are committed to your success and will provide training, mentorship, and unique exposure to people and experiences that come through our vast network and 20-year history in venture.

Intelletec has teamed up with a tech firm on a mission to solve the biggest, most intractable challenges of enterprise software. They envision the rise of the Self-Driving Enterprise: a more autonomously functioning business with a central operating system that connects and orchestrates business operations. Due to rapid growth, they are looking to hire a Director of Data Science to grow their operation across the US and build out a world class data science team The Company Backed by some of the world’s best investors with $94 million for growth and research At the forefront of cognitive automation, transforming the way we work using Artificial Intelligence Deliver the technology that enables the Self-Driving Enterprise: a cognitive operating system that connects you with your business and autonomously orchestrates your operations Serves the Global 1000 from 8 offices, and is headquartered in Mountain View, California The role Base out of global headquareters in Mountain View, California or San Francisco offices Reports into the Co-founder / CTO of the organization Leading a Data Science function with high visibility and strategic impact Take on and lead large cutting edge data science projects, from inception to completion being somewhat hands-on Collaborate with other team members to build data-science products and services You will be working on new and challenging data science applications, using Machine Learning to solve complex business problems  What you need to succeed: Excellent leadership and communication skills, comfortable articulating technical terminoly in layman terms to key stakeholders, clients and influencers Leading a Data Science function and having experience of managing global teams  10-15 years of professional experience as a Machine Learning Engineer/Data Scientist; preferably in a product development setting Master’s or PhD Degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics or a related quantitative field with a focus on Machine Learning or Deep Learning. Ph.D. preferred Good intuitive understanding of machine learning algorithms and practical experience building models with incremental/iterative approach Hands-on experience with machine learning toolkits such as scikit-learn and TensorFlow Hands-on experience with software development, including translating ML models into scalable production services Experience working with cloud platforms such as AWS, and Google Cloud Platform and distributed computing technologies such as Apache Spark  If you share a passion for building the next generation of enterprise software and implementing it for the most sophisticated customers in the world, you’ve met your match.  Market leading package available.

About the Team You will be part of the Marketing Data Science team responsible for optimizing our marketing investment and personalization experiences. About the Role As the Manager of Data Science, you will lead the strategy and management of our multi-touch attribution platform to measure incrementality and inform our Test & Learn agenda. In addition, you will be responsible for the creation of targeting and personalization assets to deliver the right content at the right time through the right channel. You will work with the CRM, Digital, Loyalty and Tech teams to test these assets, assess the value, implement and iterate to drive more value. We have a multi-dimensional customer data landscape that you will leverage to provide analytics support for strategic marketing projects. You're excited about this opportunity because you will...  *  Work with our multi-touch attribution modeling vendor to ensure alignment on modeling methodologies, model validation metrics and actionable insights. *  Build product category level multi-touch attribution models, segmentation models and MMM models in-house *  Analyze, gain insights and create personalization assets from consumer conversion paths and journeys *  Collaborate with marketing, brand and IT stakeholders in upstream ideation and inception of marketing programs; participate in and offer insights on data availability, performance measurability and analytic opportunities  Why you will love working at Williams-Sonoma, Inc.  *  We're a successful, fast-growing company with an entrepreneurial vibe *  A technologically and data-driven business *  Competitive salaries and comprehensive health benefits *  We're at the forefront of tech and retail, redefining technology for the next generation *  We're passionate about our internal and external clients and live/breathe the client experience *  We get to be creative on a daily basis *  A smart, experienced leadership team that wants to do it right and is open to new ideas *  We believe in autonomy and reward taking initiative *  We have fun!  We're excited about you because you have...  *  Masters/Advanced degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Physics, Operations Research, Computer Science, Applied Analytics or other quantitative field. *  2+ years MTA/MMM modeling experience *  3-4 years of statistical modeling experience *  6-8 years of business-based analytics, part of which includes hands-on data analysis experience with SAS, SQL or other similar analytic programming languages. *  1-2 years of people manager experience a plus *  Project management experience in advanced analytics or complex data Mining, machine learning, or predictive modeling desired *  Advanced knowledge of statistical/ query programming languages such as SQL, SAS, R, Python, Hive, Spark, Java, Perl *  Demonstrated ability to work effectively with cross-functional teams in collaborative environment and develop analytic solutions and present findings to internal stakeholders (executive level) in the organization. *  Excellent analytic and critical thinking, combined with strong written and verbal communication skills *  Experience with multi-channel retail consumer data such as POS and clickstream data  About Williams-Sonoma, Inc.  Founded in 1956, Williams-Sonoma, Inc. is the premier specialty retailer of high-quality products for the kitchen and home in the United States. Our family of brands are Williams-Sonoma, Pottery Barn, Pottery Barn Kids, PBteen, West Elm, Williams-Sonoma Home, Rejuvenation, and Mark and Graham. These brands are among the best known and most respected in the industry. We offer beautifully-designed, stylish and functional products for every area of the home, including the kitchen, living room, bedroom, home office, closet, laundry room and even outdoor spaces. We've seen some big changes since our first brick-and-mortar store opened more than half of a century ago. What hasn't changed is our passion for high-quality products, functional design, outstanding customer service, and enhancing the lives of our customers and the communities where we operate. Today, we're a multi-brand, multi-channel, global enterprise supported by state-of-the-art technology and some of the most talented teams in retailing - and we're always looking for new energy and ideas. Benefits: Once you are here, you can look forward to a wide variety of benefits. Our corporate vision--to enhance our customers' quality of life at home--extends to the lives of our associates. To that end, we offer an extensive benefits package designed to help you grow, personally and professionally, to keep you healthy, to prepare you for the unexpected, to care for your family and to build a secure future. Depending on your position and your location, here's a look at what you might be eligible for:  *  A generous discount on all Williams Sonoma Inc. brands through multiple shopping channels *  A 401(k) plan and other investment opportunities *  Paid vacations, holidays and other time-off programs *  Health benefits, including health, dental and vision insurance; health and dependent care tax-free spending accounts; medical, family and bereavement leave; same-sex domestic partner benefits; short- and long-term disability programs; life and travel insurance; an employee assistance program *  Tax-free commuter benefits *  A wellness program that supports your physical, financial and emotional health *  In-person and online learning opportunities through WSI University, LearnIt and AcademyX *  Cross-brand and cross-function career opportunities *  Quarterly sample sales *  A business casual work environment *  A bike share program *  Time off to volunteer *  Matching donations to qualifying nonprofit organizations *  Company-sponsored walks and runs *  Healthy, organic options in the cafeteria and an awesome salad bar *  Discounts on nearby gyms and other local businesses  WSI will not now or in the future commence an immigration case or "sponsor" an individual for this position (for example, H-1B or other employment-based immigration This role is not eligible for relocation assistance.

Position SummaryData is CAQH’s most critical asset. You will change how we understand and work with it. CAQH is seeking a hands-on leader for our Health Data Science team. The Data Science Lead will take the prime role in analyzing and delivering results based on large health care databases – from CAQH, from health plans and third parties. They will preferably have experience in health plan performance and quality measurement and comparative effectiveness analysis. As a senior member of the Solutions team, the selected individual will contribute to business development activities and will mentor the research staff. The successful candidate can understand content area, determine what the data means, define analysis plans, select appropriate statistical methods, conduct quantitative analysis, program solutions in statistical or other programming languages, ensure an effective quality analysis plan, and communicate with clients. This is a highly technical and applied leadership position requiring experience with data science, algorithms, software development and large-scale databases.This role is full-time exempt position and reports to the Director, Technology.Specific Responsibilities Set the direction and development of CAQH’s research and performance measurement activities by generating research ideas, investigating data and developing data design and data structures related to the projects. Build, lead and mature a Data Science team to support the breadth of CAQH needs. Work within the team and across our products on the design, execution, and reporting of projects. Engage the data team to enhance their intellectual curiosity and technical skills. Study our data from multiple angles, determine what the data means and recommends the best possible way to analyze it. Spot trends and patterns determining what is noise and what is good data and convey that understanding to others. Develop analytical plans for research and analytics including: algorithm selection (data mining, machine learning etc.), advanced probability & statistics, predictive modeling, machine learning, relational database design, program design, selection of statistical methods and development of formats. Conduct programming tasks and statistical analyses including preparation and cleaning of data, implementation and refinement of statistical methods, preparation of results, creation of databases and other outputs, and verification of the accuracy of results. Participate in quality assurance processes. Lead, design, plan, and execute programming approaches to support various development projects. Code at an expert level in applications such as SAS, R, Python. Drive relational database design as well as the use of MongoDB and Hadoop/HDF. Present analytic results to customers, CAQH staff and other researchers incorporating descriptions of methods, relevant literature, and other background material to provide context for the results. Represent CAQH to technical and business audiences. Advance the company’s reputation as a leading provider of quality assured provider data. Enhance CAQH reputation for scientific leadership in performance measurement through publications, conference talks, etc. Lead technical (econometric modeling/statistics) reviews of health-related proposals and deliverablesSupervisory ResponsibilityManage a small but growing data science team, ensuring they deliver against current commitments and can grow into our future needs.Skills Strong quantitative skills, including random assignment evaluation, quasi-experimental design, and mixed method evaluation strategies. Skilled at developing and applying univariate and multivariate modeling techniques, hypothesis testing. Proficiency in statistical software packages strong programming skills in other languages such as Python, C# or Java required. Certifications a plus. Excellent ability to communicate complex technical material, both orally and in writing with the ability to explain complex models and analysis in layman terms. Preferably an extensive knowledge of one or more of the following areas: Medicare, Medicaid, comparative effectiveness, provider data. A track record of publications is a plus.Experience Five+ years of experience delivering algorithm innovation into commercial software-based products. Three or more years of experience analyzing large datasets. Three or more years as a lead with experience in managing a team.EducationMaster’s degree (PhD preferred) in Mathematics or Computer Science with experience in health services research, applied statistics or a combination of education and experience which demonstrates the necessary skills and abilities.Who We AreNamed one of Modern Healthcare’s Best Places to Work in 2016, 2017 and 2018 CAQH, a non-profit alliance, is the leader in creating shared initiatives to streamline the business of healthcare. Through collaboration and innovation, CAQH accelerates the transformation of business processes, delivering value to providers, patients and health plans. COB Smart® quickly and accurately directs coordination of benefits processes. EnrollHub® reduces costly paper checks with enrollment for electronic payments and electronic remittance advice. CAQH ProView® eases the burden of provider data collection, maintenance and distribution. DirectAssure® increases the accuracy of health plan provider directories. VeriFideTM streamlines credentialing by consolidating and standardizing primary source verification. SanctionsTrack® delivers comprehensive, multi-state information on healthcare provider licensure disciplinary actions. CAQH CORE® maximizes business efficiency and savings by developing and implementing national operating rules. CAQH Index® benchmarks progress and helps optimize operations by tracking industry adoption of electronic administrative transactions.What You GetCAQH recognizes that its most important asset is its growing team of smart, creative, collaborative, forward-thinking and passionate professionals – and that a comprehensive employee benefits package is an important factor for them in choosing where to work. CAQH offers competitive compensation along with an extensive benefits package for all full-time employees, including medical, dental and vision coverage, tuition assistance and a 401k. Our location in downtown Washington, DC is metro-accessible, has an onsite fitness center and is centrally located to allow our team to take advantage of professional networking opportunities, cultural offerings and a thriving social scene.

Director, Data Science Job DescriptionTeradata has a great opportunity for a data science enthusiast with a discovery mindset to join Artificial Intelligence and Data Science organization. Teradata is seeking an experienced data scientist to lead a team of data scientists and data engineers in the product development group. The Director of Data Science will manage the data science team, ensuring proper execution of functions within the department. He/She will lead the department’s engagement with business stakeholders and executives and partners with these stakeholders and executives in enhancing the existing data management methodologies and developing new approaches and methodologies. He/she with the team of data scientists and data engineers will work collaboratively to extract value from large datasets using database processing, statistics, and advanced machine learning techniques. This role will leverage advanced data-science tools to explore and analyze datasets, construct models, ascertain their performance, and place them in production.Key ResponsibilitiesLeadership/Supervisory Role  The primary role of the Director of Data Science is heading the data science organization within Artificial Intelligence and Data Science organization. In this position, he/she is responsible for developing the data science vision and overseeing its adoption among data scientists and data engineers. The Director of Data Science oversees the data science group’s training and competency development, determining best practices and work standards. He/she additionally leads the department in the development of new insights, advanced modeling techniques, and data science capabilities. In his leadership capacity, the Director of Data Science with his team, is also responsible for the preparation of white papers, conference presentations, and scientific publications.Collaboration The Director of Data Science is also a collaborative one and in this position, he/she partners with senior business executives and key stakeholders in creating the data science roadmap to improve the overall business performance. The Director of Data Science will collaborate with data science team members to evaluate models and datasets. The Director of Data Science partners with other non-technical departments within the business assisting them in understanding how data science can benefit them and improve their effectiveness and performance. Analytics The Director of Data Science will play an analytical role where he/she will be responsible for the evaluation of analytics and machine learning technologies in use in the business. The Director of Data Science communicates the findings to key stakeholders through reports and presentations with whom he/she makes any necessary changes. It is also the role of the Director of Data Science to design and architect data processing pipelines for the department. He/she will construct prototype large-scale models through a comprehensive data-science workflow—from data acquisition and preparation to model training and performance evaluation, to manage models in production. In this analytical position, the Director of Data Science further drives the collection of new data as well as the refinement of existing business data sources. He/she drives exploration of datasets and development and deployment of models in accordance to business priorities.Knowledge The Director of Data Science takes initiative and stays up to date with the latest data science trends, techniques, and best practices, determining how to incorporate the most suitable practices in the department. He/she with the team of data scientists and data engineers will conduct comparative analysis of data-science technologies.Required Skills And ExperienceMaster’s degree (PhD preferred) in Statistics, Machine Learning, Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics, or any other related quantitative field. An equivalent of the same in working experience is also acceptable for the positionExperience in scalable data science and analytics, including model building, data cleansing, visualization, machine learning algorithms.Practical in-depth experience with developing scalable, big data models5+ years of experience writing Python, R, SQL, C, C++ code related to data analysis and data scienceExperience with Data/Science Engineering, Software development, Machine Learning, statistics, Linux systems, GitHub, JIRAExperience at managing deliverables and milestones that meet business needsEffective written and verbal communication skillsAbility to influence5+ years of people management experienceDesired Skills And Education5 years of combined technical big data and data science experience is required. This role also requires a demonstrated ability to successfully extract business value from complex data from modeling, excellent communication skills, a willingness to perform data science tasks, and provide guidance to individuals and teams, and can present ideas and results to industry audiences at multiple levels and in multiple forums.LocationPosition can be based either in San Diego, CA or Santa Clara, CAWith all the investments made in analytics, it’s time to stop buying into partial solutions that overpromise and underdeliver. It’s time to invest in answers. Only Teradata leverages all of the data, all of the time, so that customers can analyze anything, deploy anywhere, and deliver analytics that matter most to them. And we do it at scale, on-premises, in the Cloud, or anywhere in between.We call this Pervasive Data Intelligence. It’s the answer to the complexity, cost, and inadequacy of today’s analytics. And it's the way Teradata transforms how businesses work and people live through the power of data throughout the world. Join us and help create the era of Pervasive Data Intelligence.

At Carta, we design products that transform the way hospitals use data to deliver care. We make analyzing data fast, easy, and useful for everyone. We're looking for Data Scientists skilled at rapid iteration and excited about solving problems that can save lives. This is a startup role, where we will ask you to wear many hats and solve many different types of problems.Best of all, when we say Data Science Internship, we mean Data Science internship--no grunt work, no code cleanup, no bug fixes. Like kaggle, you'll be solving incredibly interesting Data Science puzzles but, unlike kaggle, every puzzle you solve will measurably help save people's lives and save our healthcare system. We'll give you a unique experience to see how far you can push your Data Science skills that you won't be able to find anywhere else.You love solving complex engineering problems, by creating beautiful, and well-tested algorithms. You enjoy building new features and writing elegant code. If this describes you--you belong at Carta.We have open positions in Fall and Winter and we will be reaching out to you in July regarding this role.Excited to talk to you!

Airbnb has become a global platform that connects travelers and hosts from over 34,000 cities. At the backbone of this is a world class customer support team and the innovative technology that enables them. We believe that our service will be a major differentiator and drive Airbnb’s global success and growth.The Support Products team is building a technology platform that supports Airbnb as it scales, delivering an exceptional level of customer service while also improving efficiency and the customer service agent experience. Machine learning is key to this vision.We are seeking a Data Science Manager to work out of our growing Seattle office to lead a strong team of data scientists to drive strategy for using machine learning to transform Airbnb support. In addition to collaborating with engineers, designers and product managers, you will leverage Airbnb’s rich and unique data and state-of-art machine learning infrastructure.We have an incredible team of data scientists, our work is highly sought-after, and our impact on the business is tremendous. If you have a proven background in this field and are excited to help build Airbnb’s community, we want to hear from you.Some Projects That You Would Lead Predicting when a customer might have an issue and proactively providing self-solve options. Conversational assistant (Chatbot) to solve simple cases with minimal human intervention, gather relevant information, and escalate to human agents when necessary. Smart Customer Support Agent Tools or automated resolution tools to enable efficient and consistent resolution of users’ help requests Route customer issues to the right customer service agent, matching supply and demand to minimize customer wait times. Capacity planning models to staff agents with time varying demand and variable service time to achieve near zero wait time Some Examples Of Traits That We Value PhD or equivalent work experience in a quantitative field preferred 5+ years in industry, customer service experience preferred 3+ years of mentorship and management experience Ability to write and mentor code development in SQL and Python Ability to partner with a diverse set of stakeholders globally Strong understanding of statistics and machine learning, natural language processing experience preferred Intuition for data science best practices, stemming from proven experience Steadfast focus on creating impactful change  Benefits Stock $2,000 yearly employee travel coupon Competitive salary Paid time off Medical, dental, & vision insurance Life & disability coverage 401K Flexible Spending Accounts Apple equipment Daily breakfast, lunch, and dinner We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Title:              Manager of Data Science Location:     NY Office   Overview: The Data Science team is responsible for analyzing vast amounts of data to better understand and predict customer behavior that in turn informs business decisions and improves J.Crew Group customers’ experiences. Our team has a broad mandate, handling customer analysis across the entire organization and informing marketing, merchandising, planning, stores/field, budgeting, and other financial decisions. The Manager position is responsible for designing an appropriate methodology, accessing and analyzing large amounts of data, and synthesizing findings into insights for strategic ad hoc projects as well as routine reporting.   Responsibilities include: ·      Regularly liaise with the marketing, loyalty, merchandising, and stores teams to understand their business needs and provide the right analyses/insights based on their key strategies and issues ·      Field ad hoc requests for customer analysis, acting as an analytical thought partner to the business stakeholder and assigning the appropriate analytical approach ·      Conduct advanced customer analyses and arrive at compelling data conclusions; translate data findings/trends into actionable insights to better understand complex shopping behavior ·      Own, design, develop and distribute customer reports and dashboards that clearly track the effectiveness of strategies underway ·      Pull large sets of customer data from J.Crew’s customer database and audit the quality of this data against other data sources ·      Work closely with vendors to ensure the integrity of data and analyses from the vendors ·      Liaise with our customer database provider to ensure data feeds contain all necessary information, are processed correctly and manage any changes or updates to the current database to support the growing business needs ·     Build predictive models to improve profitability, growth, retention, customer lifetime value, and other key performance indicators for our business stakeholders ·     Implement formal modeling processes from end-to-end including data gathering, data profiling, numerical model building, calibration, cross-validation, putting the product into production, etc. ·     Present any and all analytical findings in easy-to-understand presentations, making clear recommendations based on deep insights into the data ·     Advise on experimental designs to ensure new business strategies are tested appropriately and without bias; assist stakeholders in parsing results, arriving at conclusions and advising on next steps, when needed ·     Act as a subject matter expert on best practices in retail customer analysis   The ideal candidate is: ·     Analytical and curious, especially about how numbers can define company strategy ·     An excellent oral and written communicator who can clearly tell stories based on insights into the data ·     Understands the retail industry and the analyses common in the trade ·     Has advanced project management skills and efficiently manages tasks to completion ·     Extremely detail oriented ·     Has an entrepreneurial mindset and is comfortable with both change and ambiguity ·     Eager to continually improve his/her analytical and technical skills ·     Has a positive, can-do attitude and wants to be part of a critical team   Education & Experience Requirements: ·      Master’s degree preferred in a quantitative field ·      At least 5 years’ previous work experience in retail/e-commerce   ·      Superior research, statistical, analytical, processing and mathematical skills with the ability to structure and conduct analyses ·      Strong proficiency in SQL, R and/or Python, and Microsoft Office Suite ·      Working knowledge of AWS toolkit, including S3, Athena, Glue, and Sagemaker

Founded by the creators of Anaconda, NumPy and SciPy, Saturn provides a powerful data science platform for teams to build and manage data products. Organization DescriptionAutoGrid's mission is to organize the exponentially increasing amount of energy data produced from a networked and automated grid and make it useful and actionable for electricity generators and providers, grid operators, and electricity users.With deployments of smart meters, distributed generation, and other building and grid sensing technologies now reaching critical mass, all participants in the electricity supply chain find themselves having to process and analyze thousands of times more data than they've had before. Most organizations that produce or consume electricity have yet to take advantage of this information to improve their decision-making processes and lower their costs.AutoGrid enables Utilities, Electricity Service Providers, Grid Operators, DR Aggregators, and End-Users to precisely forecast, monitor and control power consumption securely and in real-time, maximizing the value of existing assets with Software Defined Power Plants.Job DescriptionAutoGrid is seeking Data Science Interns for Summer 2018. We are a rapidly growing company with significant market traction and a large pipeline of diverse opportunities. As such the role will be dynamic and varied, requiring a versatile self-starter willing to dive in to multiple initiatives. Over 10+ weeks the intern can expect to become deeply involved in implementing user features and analytics models that will run in production.Our goal is to give the intern exposure to a range of data science techniques and current big data technologies, through the experience of applying them to the energy industry. This role will provide an excellent opportunity to implement features that run in production, at scale.QualificationsExperience in one or more of the following:PythonStream processing frameworksSQLBig Data analyticsAlgorithms in machine learning and econometrics: eg. random forest, SVR, ARIMAExperience in energy and electric utilities is a plus

At Mozilla, we want to protect the Internet as a global resource, open and accessible to all. We collect terabytes of data a day from millions of users to guide our decision-making. We could use your help.As a manager on the data science team, you will own a critical piece of the Mozilla organization. Data scientists work closely with our policy, legal, and business development teams to enable decisions and contribute insights that push our mission forward and in the right direction. They build models and design experiments that improve our understanding about the operation of our business and products to ensure that we are optimizing our decisions for maximum impact on the market. We are looking for an opinionated manager with technical chops who is excited to marshal a data science team to shape the future of the Web. You will manage a small team of data scientists and will be responsible for career mentorship and technical guidance. You will work with leadership to define and execute strategies that demonstrate the value of the data contributed by our users while maintaining an ethical set of principles to guide your practice.As a data science manager... You are comfortable steering a team of 2-7 data scientists to align with business priorities, legal and policy agendas, and Mozilla’s greater mission You pride yourself on your ability to communicate technical concepts to diverse audiences across Mozilla You define requirements for data scientists to other parts of the Mozilla organization You collaborate with cross-functional management to create new initiatives and refine existing processes that increase the impact of the data science team You possess a strategic mindset and find motivation in creatively solving problems You establish best practices for data science workflows and know how to create an environment and team culture that enables data scientists to perform at their best You have a strong desire to contribute to Mozilla’s mission through data science Your professional profile Up to 3 years of industry experience in the data science (or related) profession and up to 1 year of experience managing data scientists or other similar management experience. It is fine that you may be relatively early in your career, and we appreciate the expectation that you will grow in this role. You have experience with a breadth of analytical methodologies and possess a solid foundation in numerous statistical techniques You also have experience with common data science technologies, namely SQL, Python, or R, as well as familiarity with conventional code and programming concepts You have strong communication skills; experience speaking at industry or academic conferences a plus You consider contributing to a collaborative and open team culture an important responsibility About MozillaMozilla exists to build the Internet as a public resource accessible to all because we believe that open and free is better than closed and controlled. When you work at Mozilla, you give yourself a chance to make a difference in the lives of Web users everywhere. And you give us a chance to make a difference in your life every single day. Join us to work on the Web as the platform and help create more opportunity and innovation for everyone online.We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.Group: D

At PatientPop, we believe healthcare providers should focus their attention on delivering quality care to patients. That's why we take a holistic approach to improving every digital touchpoint along the patient journey with the leading all-in-one practice growth solution.We've helped thousands of providers since our founding in 2014. Along the way, we cultivated an incredible work environment — one of the best, according to Great Place to Work.Our dedicated team brings a blend of experiences that drives innovation and customer success. Our culture of continuous innovation allows employees to thrive personally and professionally. And our bustling (dog-friendly!) offices are in an enviable location: just two blocks from the beach and around the corner from 3rd Street Promenade.Now, we want you to be a part of it all.Must be available to work in our Santa Monica, CA office. The position is for 40 hours per week for 2-3 months during the summer.How You Will ContributeAt PatientPop, we are building a world-class data science and analytics practice. We are looking for a data science intern to join our growing team and derive insights from our rich and diverse data sources. This is an exciting opportunity to get in on the ground floor and help grow the presence and impact of data-driven solutions to a variety of business challenges.What You’ll Do  Work with our Senior Data Scientist and business stakeholders from marketing, sales, product, customer success and finance to solve key business challenges   Conduct in-depth analyses and build and deploy models to understand and predict outcomes related to acquiring and retaining customers   Create beautiful and informative visualizations and dashboards   Identify actionable insights that positively impact revenue  Who You Are  Master’s or Ph.D candidate in Data Science, Analytics, or Information Science with a Machine Learning focus (or equivalent training and experience)   Prior internship or work experience in a data-intensive role strongly preferred   Bonus points for experience with any of the following: XGBoost models (including development, hyperparameter tuning and feature interpretation), machine learning with imbalanced datasets, LIME analysis, Shap values, lead scoring algorithms, clustering, Git, Flask/Dash apps   Sound knowledge of analytical, statistical and machine learning methods   Proficiency in SQL and Python (pandas, numpy, plotly)   Excellent written and verbal communication skills   Curious, motivated, self-starter, team player   Passionate about high quality, insightful data analysis  PatientPop has one simple mission: help healthcare practices thrive. Our solution is the leading all-in-one practice growth platform that's HIPAA-compliant and helps providers promote their practice online, attract patients, and retain them for life. Learn more at patientpop.com

Job DescriptionWhat we are looking forSimply put, we are looking for future leaders for our organization. We are seeking innovators, collaborators, and problem solvers. translate data findings/trends into actionable insights to better understand complex shopping behavior ·      Own, design, develop and distribute customer reports and dashboards that clearly track the effectiveness of strategies underway ·      Pull large sets of customer data from J.Crew’s customer database and audit the quality of this data against other data sources ·      Work closely with vendors to ensure the integrity of data and analyses from the vendors ·      Liaise with our customer database provider to ensure data feeds contain all necessary information, are processed correctly and manage any changes or updates to the current database to support the growing business needs ·     Build predictive models to improve profitability, growth, retention, customer lifetime value, and other key performance indicators for our business stakeholders ·     Implement formal modeling processes from end-to-end including data gathering, data profiling, numerical model building, calibration, cross-validation, putting the product into production, etc. ·     Present any and all analytical findings in easy-to-understand presentations, making clear recommendations based on deep insights into the data ·     Advise on experimental designs to ensure new business strategies are tested appropriately and without bias; assist stakeholders in parsing results, arriving at conclusions and advising on next steps, when needed ·     Act as a subject matter expert on best practices in retail customer analysis   The ideal candidate is: ·     Analytical and curious, especially about how numbers can define company strategy ·     An excellent oral and written communicator who can clearly tell stories based on insights into the data ·     Understands the retail industry and the analyses common in the trade ·     Has advanced project management skills and efficiently manages tasks to completion ·     Extremely detail oriented ·     Has an entrepreneurial mindset and is comfortable with both change and ambiguity ·     Eager to continually improve his/her analytical and technical skills ·     Has a positive, can-do attitude and wants to be part of a critical team   Education & Experience Requirements: ·      Master’s degree preferred in a quantitative field ·      At least 5 years’ previous work experience in retail/e-commerce   ·      Superior research, statistical, analytical, processing and mathematical skills with the ability to structure and conduct analyses ·      Strong proficiency in SQL, R and/or Python, and Microsoft Office Suite ·      Working knowledge of AWS toolkit, including S3, Athena, Glue, and Sagemaker

Comcast Ventures is seeking a data scientist to take the reins of, and lead our data-driven investment effort. Here at Comcast Ventures we leverage a variety of data sources to augment our investment process, from sourcing deals to conducting due-diligence and helping our portfolio companies. You will apply your business acumen and analytical skills to find great investment prospects, and partner with relevant team members to drive the investments. Finally, you will work with a select group of companies within the invite only accelerate program to help support and scale their businesses beyond the investment phase. About Comcast Ventures:Comcast Ventures is a financially-focused venture capital firm with the backing of Comcast as its sole LP. The team was founded in 1999 and invests across a broad array of industries including consumer, enterprise, and frontier technologies. The firm has offices in San Francisco, New York, Philadelphia and Los Angeles. To learn more about our team and our investments, visit www.comcastventures.com. About You:You have both excellent quantitative skills and great business acumen. You are very intellectually curious and enjoy thinking about problems at a high level. However, you are no spring chicken when it comes to getting deep in the analytical weeds to validate your hypotheses. You have a strong foundation in statistics and enjoy solving problems with data. You are interested in investing and want to help build scalable solutions to spot early traction in startups and help them grow. Finally, you enjoy interfacing with entrepreneurs and investors alike, and have no problem presenting your convictions to drive action. Aspects of the Job:- Developing and testing data-driven hypotheses around business models, industries, and ecosystems- Building and implementing scalable data models that identify early signs of product-market fit and company traction- Becoming a thought leader in data-driven venture investing- Sourcing and assisting on deals utilizing data, and influencing the investment team with data-driven findings- Build financial and predictive models on a variety of strategic initiatives for companies participating in the accelerate program.- Use external and internal data enrichment methods to improve customer acquisition efforts for portfolio companies- Analyze and interpret both internal and external data, and make it actionable for business purpose- Gain in-depth knowledge of how a successful start-up operates Qualifications:- 2+ years of experience in quantitative analysis- BA/BS in Computer Science, Engineering, Physics, Math, Engineering, Statistics or other technical field- Proficiency with Python and SQL. Expert in at least one statistical modeling/machine learning software (Python preferred)- 1+ years of hands-on, practical Excel use- Demonstrable critical thinking and analytical skills, including the ability and conviction to make conclusions and recommendations from data- Experience interacting with key stakeholders, and converting opportunities into actionable data-driven analysis and implementing science-driven data products- Strong verbal and written communication skills- Ability to work independently and in a team- Passion to learn a business from the inside out and propel its growth- Comfort with and aptitude for critically analyzing large quantities of data- Ability to clearly articulate and defend analytical findings Why Work Here:The Data Science role is an invaluable opportunity to learn the venture capital business while embedded in a team of experienced investors and seasoned operators. You will have access to unique and powerful datasets with the freedom to carve your own path and make advances in the nascent field of quantitative venture capital. Through your work here, you will gain an in depth understanding of different business models, how to judge their health and what levers exist to improve upon them. We are committed to your success and will provide training, mentorship, and unique exposure to people and experiences that come through our vast network and 20-year history in venture.

About the Team You will be part of the Marketing Data Science team responsible for optimizing our marketing investment and personalization experiences. About the Role As the Manager of Data Science, you will lead the strategy and management of our multi-touch attribution platform to measure incrementality and inform our Test & Learn agenda. In addition, you will be responsible for the creation of targeting and personalization assets to deliver the right content at the right time through the right channel. You will work with the CRM, Digital, Loyalty and Tech teams to test these assets, assess the value, implement and iterate to drive more value. We have a multi-dimensional customer data landscape that you will leverage to provide analytics support for strategic marketing projects. You're excited about this opportunity because you will...  *  Work with our multi-touch attribution modeling vendor to ensure alignment on modeling methodologies, model validation metrics and actionable insights. *  Build product category level multi-touch attribution models, segmentation models and MMM models in-house *  Analyze, gain insights and create personalization assets from consumer conversion paths and journeys *  Collaborate with marketing, brand and IT stakeholders in upstream ideation and inception of marketing programs; participate in and offer insights on data availability, performance measurability and analytic opportunities  Why you will love working at Williams-Sonoma, Inc.  *  We're a successful, fast-growing company with an entrepreneurial vibe *  A technologically and data-driven business *  Competitive salaries and comprehensive health benefits *  We're at the forefront of tech and retail, redefining technology for the next generation *  We're passionate about our internal and external clients and live/breathe the client experience *  We get to be creative on a daily basis *  A smart, experienced leadership team that wants to do it right and is open to new ideas *  We believe in autonomy and reward taking initiative *  We have fun!  We're excited about you because you have...  *  Masters/Advanced degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Physics, Operations Research, Computer Science, Applied Analytics or other quantitative field. *  2+ years MTA/MMM modeling experience *  3-4 years of statistical modeling experience *  6-8 years of business-based analytics, part of which includes hands-on data analysis experience with SAS, SQL or other similar analytic programming languages. *  1-2 years of people manager experience a plus *  Project management experience in advanced analytics or complex data Mining, machine learning, or predictive modeling desired *  Advanced knowledge of statistical/ query programming languages such as SQL, SAS, R, Python, Hive, Spark, Java, Perl *  Demonstrated ability to work effectively with cross-functional teams in collaborative environment and develop analytic solutions and present findings to internal stakeholders (executive level) in the organization. *  Excellent analytic and critical thinking, combined with strong written and verbal communication skills *  Experience with multi-channel retail consumer data such as POS and clickstream data  About Williams-Sonoma, Inc.  Founded in 1956, Williams-Sonoma, Inc. is the premier specialty retailer of high-quality products for the kitchen and home in the United States. Our family of brands are Williams-Sonoma, Pottery Barn, Pottery Barn Kids, PBteen, West Elm, Williams-Sonoma Home, Rejuvenation, and Mark and Graham. These brands are among the best known and most respected in the industry. We offer beautifully-designed, stylish and functional products for every area of the home, including the kitchen, living room, bedroom, home office, closet, laundry room and even outdoor spaces. We've seen some big changes since our first brick-and-mortar store opened more than half of a century ago. What hasn't changed is our passion for high-quality products, functional design, outstanding customer service, and enhancing the lives of our customers and the communities where we operate. Today, we're a multi-brand, multi-channel, global enterprise supported by state-of-the-art technology and some of the most talented teams in retailing - and we're always looking for new energy and ideas. Benefits: Once you are here, you can look forward to a wide variety of benefits. Our corporate vision--to enhance our customers' quality of life at home--extends to the lives of our associates. To that end, we offer an extensive benefits package designed to help you grow, personally and professionally, to keep you healthy, to prepare you for the unexpected, to care for your family and to build a secure future. Depending on your position and your location, here's a look at what you might be eligible for:  *  A generous discount on all Williams Sonoma Inc. brands through multiple shopping channels *  A 401(k) plan and other investment opportunities *  Paid vacations, holidays and other time-off programs *  Health benefits, including health, dental and vision insurance; health and dependent care tax-free spending accounts; medical, family and bereavement leave; same-sex domestic partner benefits; short- and long-term disability programs; life and travel insurance; an employee assistance program *  Tax-free commuter benefits *  A wellness program that supports your physical, financial and emotional health *  In-person and online learning opportunities through WSI University, LearnIt and AcademyX *  Cross-brand and cross-function career opportunities *  Quarterly sample sales *  A business casual work environment *  A bike share program *  Time off to volunteer *  Matching donations to qualifying nonprofit organizations *  Company-sponsored walks and runs *  Healthy, organic options in the cafeteria and an awesome salad bar *  Discounts on nearby gyms and other local businesses  WSI will not now or in the future commence an immigration case or "sponsor" an individual for this position (for example, H-1B or other employment-based immigration This role is not eligible for relocation assistance.

Position SummaryData is CAQH’s most critical asset. You will change how we understand and work with it. CAQH is seeking a hands-on leader for our Health Data Science team. The Data Science Lead will take the prime role in analyzing and delivering results based on large health care databases – from CAQH, from health plans and third parties. They will preferably have experience in health plan performance and quality measurement and comparative effectiveness analysis. As a senior member of the Solutions team, the selected individual will contribute to business development activities and will mentor the research staff. The successful candidate can understand content area, determine what the data means, define analysis plans, select appropriate statistical methods, conduct quantitative analysis, program solutions in statistical or other programming languages, ensure an effective quality analysis plan, and communicate with clients. This is a highly technical and applied leadership position requiring experience with data science, algorithms, software development and large-scale databases.This role is full-time exempt position and reports to the Director, Technology.Specific Responsibilities Set the direction and development of CAQH’s research and performance measurement activities by generating research ideas, investigating data and developing data design and data structures related to the projects. Build, lead and mature a Data Science team to support the breadth of CAQH needs. Work within the team and across our products on the design, execution, and reporting of projects. Engage the data team to enhance their intellectual curiosity and technical skills. Study our data from multiple angles, determine what the data means and recommends the best possible way to analyze it. Spot trends and patterns determining what is noise and what is good data and convey that understanding to others. Develop analytical plans for research and analytics including: algorithm selection (data mining, machine learning etc.), advanced probability & statistics, predictive modeling, machine learning, relational database design, program design, selection of statistical methods and development of formats. Conduct programming tasks and statistical analyses including preparation and cleaning of data, implementation and refinement of statistical methods, preparation of results, creation of databases and other outputs, and verification of the accuracy of results. Participate in quality assurance processes. Lead, design, plan, and execute programming approaches to support various development projects. Code at an expert level in applications such as SAS, R, Python. Drive relational database design as well as the use of MongoDB and Hadoop/HDF. Present analytic results to customers, CAQH staff and other researchers incorporating descriptions of methods, relevant literature, and other background material to provide context for the results. Represent CAQH to technical and business audiences. Advance the company’s reputation as a leading provider of quality assured provider data. Enhance CAQH reputation for scientific leadership in performance measurement through publications, conference talks, etc. Lead technical (econometric modeling/statistics) reviews of health-related proposals and deliverablesSupervisory ResponsibilityManage a small but growing data science team, ensuring they deliver against current commitments and can grow into our future needs.Skills Strong quantitative skills, including random assignment evaluation, quasi-experimental design, and mixed method evaluation strategies. Skilled at developing and applying univariate and multivariate modeling techniques, hypothesis testing. Proficiency in statistical software packages strong programming skills in other languages such as Python, C# or Java required. Certifications a plus. Excellent ability to communicate complex technical material, both orally and in writing with the ability to explain complex models and analysis in layman terms. Preferably an extensive knowledge of one or more of the following areas: Medicare, Medicaid, comparative effectiveness, provider data. A track record of publications is a plus.Experience Five+ years of experience delivering algorithm innovation into commercial software-based products. Three or more years of experience analyzing large datasets. Three or more years as a lead with experience in managing a team.EducationMaster’s degree (PhD preferred) in Mathematics or Computer Science with experience in health services research, applied statistics or a combination of education and experience which demonstrates the necessary skills and abilities.Who We AreNamed one of Modern Healthcare’s Best Places to Work in 2016, 2017 and 2018 CAQH, a non-profit alliance, is the leader in creating shared initiatives to streamline the business of healthcare. Through collaboration and innovation, CAQH accelerates the transformation of business processes, delivering value to providers, patients and health plans. COB Smart® quickly and accurately directs coordination of benefits processes. EnrollHub® reduces costly paper checks with enrollment for electronic payments and electronic remittance advice. CAQH ProView® eases the burden of provider data collection, maintenance and distribution. DirectAssure® increases the accuracy of health plan provider directories. VeriFideTM streamlines credentialing by consolidating and standardizing primary source verification. SanctionsTrack® delivers comprehensive, multi-state information on healthcare provider licensure disciplinary actions. CAQH CORE® maximizes business efficiency and savings by developing and implementing national operating rules. CAQH Index® benchmarks progress and helps optimize operations by tracking industry adoption of electronic administrative transactions.What You GetCAQH recognizes that its most important asset is its growing team of smart, creative, collaborative, forward-thinking and passionate professionals – and that a comprehensive employee benefits package is an important factor for them in choosing where to work. CAQH offers competitive compensation along with an extensive benefits package for all full-time employees, including medical, dental and vision coverage, tuition assistance and a 401k. Our location in downtown Washington, DC is metro-accessible, has an onsite fitness center and is centrally located to allow our team to take advantage of professional networking opportunities, cultural offerings and a thriving social scene.

Feedzai is the market leader in managing financial risk with AI. Were coding the future of commerce with todays most advanced risk management platform powered by big data and machine learning. Founded and developed by data scientists and aerospace engineers, Feedzai has one mission: to make banking and commerce safe. The worlds largest banks, processors, and retailers use Feedzais fraud prevention and anti-money laundering products to manage risk, while improving customer Experience.The Customer Success team ensures our global customers achieve their business goals using our product. Everything you do matters: all your code, machine learning models, advisory, management, and other actions/roles will have a material impact on the way our clients run their business and how effectively we fight fraud and protect people from wrongdoing. You will be able to interact and meet many people from widely different cultures around the world and understand the business like few others. You will be able to say you protect people on a daily basis. You will be challenged with new technology, new processes, and new mindsets and will be asked to contribute to ensure continuous improvement. Come and change the world with us.You will be managing a distributed team of up to six (6) Data Scientists who are part of our client delivery team. The teams mission is to take on complex fraud detection problems for our enterprise level clients using Feedzais unique product and platform. In addition, the team is tasked with creatively developing and coding innovative data science solutions for our clients that can be generalized as product enhancements. Our client delivery team works with clients all over the USA. Each client project takes between 6 and 12 months to complete.Responsibilities Provide guidance to our Product and Research teams based on insights and models developed for individual clients Own the data science relationship with the client for up to 2 client projects Effectively understand business objectives and communicating data science insights and progress to a non-technical audience  Implement Feedzai's machine learning algorithm into our clients data feeds Contribute to the team knowledge by keeping up with the state-of-the-art in machine learning applied to our domains Build out and manage the new employee experience on this team Conduct the performance management process for this team  Qualifications You have a PhD, in CS, Physics, Engineering, Stats, or similar technical discipline You have experience with a range of statistical and machine learning techniques, ideally via open source libraries and proprietary models. You have experience managing teams  You can code proficiently in R/Python and an object-oriented language You have experience with big data platforms such as Hadoop, MapReduce, Spark, Hive, and Pig You are comfortable presenting to non-technical customers. Experience with building models for fraudulent financial transactions is highly valued Feedzai is an Equal Opportunity Employer.Feedzai does not accept unsolicited resumes from recruiters or employment agencies.PM19

Director, Data Science Job DescriptionTeradata has a great opportunity for a data science enthusiast with a discovery mindset to join Artificial Intelligence and Data Science organization. Teradata is seeking an experienced data scientist to lead a team of data scientists and data engineers in the product development group. The Director of Data Science will manage the data science team, ensuring proper execution of functions within the department. He/She will lead the department’s engagement with business stakeholders and executives and partners with these stakeholders and executives in enhancing the existing data management methodologies and developing new approaches and methodologies. He/she with the team of data scientists and data engineers will work collaboratively to extract value from large datasets using database processing, statistics, and advanced machine learning techniques. This role will leverage advanced data-science tools to explore and analyze datasets, construct models, ascertain their performance, and place them in production.Key ResponsibilitiesLeadership/Supervisory Role  The primary role of the Director of Data Science is heading the data science organization within Artificial Intelligence and Data Science organization. In this position, he/she is responsible for developing the data science vision and overseeing its adoption among data scientists and data engineers. The Director of Data Science oversees the data science group’s training and competency development, determining best practices and work standards. He/she additionally leads the department in the development of new insights, advanced modeling techniques, and data science capabilities. In his leadership capacity, the Director of Data Science with his team, is also responsible for the preparation of white papers, conference presentations, and scientific publications.Collaboration The Director of Data Science is also a collaborative one and in this position, he/she partners with senior business executives and key stakeholders in creating the data science roadmap to improve the overall business performance. The Director of Data Science will collaborate with data science team members to evaluate models and datasets. The Director of Data Science partners with other non-technical departments within the business assisting them in understanding how data science can benefit them and improve their effectiveness and performance. Analytics The Director of Data Science will play an analytical role where he/she will be responsible for the evaluation of analytics and machine learning technologies in use in the business. The Director of Data Science communicates the findings to key stakeholders through reports and presentations with whom he/she makes any necessary changes. It is also the role of the Director of Data Science to design and architect data processing pipelines for the department. He/she will construct prototype large-scale models through a comprehensive data-science workflow—from data acquisition and preparation to model training and performance evaluation, to manage models in production. In this analytical position, the Director of Data Science further drives the collection of new data as well as the refinement of existing business data sources. He/she drives exploration of datasets and development and deployment of models in accordance to business priorities.Knowledge The Director of Data Science takes initiative and stays up to date with the latest data science trends, techniques, and best practices, determining how to incorporate the most suitable practices in the department. He/she with the team of data scientists and data engineers will conduct comparative analysis of data-science technologies.Required Skills And ExperienceMaster’s degree (PhD preferred) in Statistics, Machine Learning, Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics, or any other related quantitative field. An equivalent of the same in working experience is also acceptable for the positionExperience in scalable data science and analytics, including model building, data cleansing, visualization, machine learning algorithms.Practical in-depth experience with developing scalable, big data models5+ years of experience writing Python, R, SQL, C, C++ code related to data analysis and data scienceExperience with Data/Science Engineering, Software development, Machine Learning, statistics, Linux systems, GitHub, JIRAExperience at managing deliverables and milestones that meet business needsEffective written and verbal communication skillsAbility to influence5+ years of people management experienceDesired Skills And Education5 years of combined technical big data and data science experience is required. This role also requires a demonstrated ability to successfully extract business value from complex data from modeling, excellent communication skills, a willingness to perform data science tasks, and provide guidance to individuals and teams, and can present ideas and results to industry audiences at multiple levels and in multiple forums.LocationPosition can be based either in San Diego, CA or Santa Clara, CAWith all the investments made in analytics, it’s time to stop buying into partial solutions that overpromise and underdeliver. It’s time to invest in answers. Only Teradata leverages all of the data, all of the time, so that customers can analyze anything, deploy anywhere, and deliver analytics that matter most to them. And we do it at scale, on-premises, in the Cloud, or anywhere in between.We call this Pervasive Data Intelligence. It’s the answer to the complexity, cost, and inadequacy of today’s analytics. And it's the way Teradata transforms how businesses work and people live through the power of data throughout the world. Join us and help create the era of Pervasive Data Intelligence.

Position DescriptionThe search algorithms team @WalmartLabs is dedicated to the mission of helping millions of customers every day in finding the right products. We are at the forefront of attacking one of the most complex problems of e-commerce. Whenever a user types in a query or browses through product categories on the web site, phone or the iPad, our service goes to work. We mine billions of search queries and tens of millions of products to find the most relevant products for our customers. Team members take end-end responsibility in analyzing large amounts of data, creating complex models, improving their accuracy and deploying these models to serve customers.As part of this team, you'll solve some of the most fascinating and impactful problems in machine learning, information retrieval, NLP or computer vision problems. The algorithms you develop will champion customers need to express their intent and our goal to understand their preferences, implicitly or explicitly across devices and modalities (voice, text, image etc.). You will develop and deploy machine learned models, to engage and converse with our customers and to understand their goals and expectations to enable them to make the right purchase decision. Your work will be visible to millions of customers and you will have a direct impact on the goals of the Fortune #1 enterprise. If you speak and think machine learning then we want to talk to you. Come join our team and be part of this exciting journey.In this role you will Act as a thought leader to identify right problems to solve for our customers Design and implement state of the art Machine Learning approaches Work as a tech lead and define the roadmap for yourself and co-workers Develop end-to-end ownership of major customer facing technologies Stay up-to-date with the state of the art techniques of Machine Learning, Information Retrieval Become an expert either in NLP, Search Ranking or Computer Vision Push the boundaries of Machine Learning to benefit internal and external community Be a brand ambassador for @WalmartLabsMinimum Qualifications PhD in computer science or similar field with 5+ years of experience Highly proficient in Python or Java Extremely hands on in building Machine Learning products Experience in building data products and crunching terabytes of data A good portfolio of machine learning projects with a significant impact on the bottom line Experience in working as a tech lead Blog posts, papers or conference talks showing your involvement in the communityAdditional Preferred Qualifications Familiarity with Deep Learning Contributions to open source ML projectsCompany SummaryThe Walmart eCommerce team is rapidly innovating to evolve and define the future state of shopping. We are at the forefront of attacking one of the most complex problems of e-commerce. Whenever a user types in a query or browses through product categories on the web site, phone or the iPad, our service goes to work. We mine billions of search queries and tens of millions of products to find the most relevant products for our customers. Team members take end-end responsibility in analyzing large amounts of data, creating complex models, improving their accuracy and deploying these models to serve customers.As part of this team, you'll solve some of the most fascinating and impactful problems in machine learning, information retrieval, NLP or computer vision problems. The algorithms you develop will champion customers need to express their intent and our goal to understand their preferences, implicitly or explicitly across devices and modalities (voice, text, image etc.).
